Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL TEST TYPE: Identifies the general type of test used to evaluate the potentialof the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), Repeat Formation Tests (RFT),Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.3: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test
Column Comment.4: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the test interval.
Column Comment.7: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.8: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.9: BOTTOM HOLE PRESSURE / Z: Value for the amount of bottom hole pressuremeasured over the compressibility (Z) factor. This is a derived value and should bepopulated programmatically.
Column Comment.10: BOTTOM CHOKE DESCRIPTION: A description of the bottom choke diameter (e.g.,1 1/2 inches).
Column Comment.11: BASIC SEDIMENT and WATER PERCENTAGE: The percentage of basic sedimentand water. The solid impurities and salt water that are mixed with crude oil. This isthe same as bottom settlings and water.
Column Comment.12: CALINER HOLE DIAMETER: Value of the diameter of the borehole measured by acaliper instrument
Column Comment.13: CALINER HOLE DIAMETER OUOM: Caliper diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.14: CASED HOLE INDICATOR: Identifies the formation test was performed in a casedhole environment.
Column Comment.15: CASING PRESSURE: Value of the pressure measured between the casing anddrillstring. Casing pressure is measured at the surface after the well has been shutin.
Column Comment.16: CASING PRESSURE OUOM: Casing pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: CHOKE SIZE DESCRIPTION: A description of the choke size (e.g., 1 1/2 inches).
Column Comment.18: COMPLETION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observation number used touniquely identify each completed (perforated) interval.
Column Comment.19: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.20: CONDENSATE AMOUNT PERCENT: Identifies the percent of condensatecomprising the total fluid produced in a specified formation during the testingoperation.
Column Comment.21: CONDENSATE FLOW AMOUNT: Amount of condensate flowed during the test.
Column Comment.22: CONDENSATE FLOW AMOUNT OUOM: Condensate flow original unit of measure.
Column Comment.23: CONDENSATE FLOW AMONT UNIT: Condensate flow unit of measure. Multiplestorage units maybe required.
Column Comment.24: CONDENSATE GRAVITY; Calculated gravity of condensate
Column Comment.25: CONDENSATE RATIO: The condensate ratio. The volume of condensate liquidsdivided by the residue gas volume.
Column Comment.26: CONDENSATE RATIO OUOM: Condensate ratio original unit of measure.
Column Comment.27: DAMAGE QUALITY: Standard quality indicators describing damage.
Column Comment.28: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.29: WELL EVENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique number for the well event.
Column Comment.30: EVENT SOURCE: Source of the well event information.
Column Comment.31: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.32: FLOW PRESSURE: Pressure on the fluid at the top or wellhead of a well as the fluidsare being produced in contrast to static pressure.
Column Comment.33: FLOW PRESSURE OUOM: Flowing pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.34: FLOW TEMPERATURE: Temperature of the drilling fluids measured at the surfaceduring a well formation test.
Column Comment.35: FLOW TEMPERATURE OUOM: Flow temperature original unit of measure.
Column Comment.36: GAS FLOW AMOUNT: Amount of gas that flowed during the production test.
Column Comment.37: GAS FLOW AMOUNT OUOM: Gas flow original unit of measure. Multiple storageunits maybe required.
Column Comment.38: GAS FLOW AMOUNT UNIT: Gas flow amount unit of measure. Multiple storage unitsmaybe required.
Column Comment.39: GAS GRAVITY: (usually reported as 1.123 to most regulatory agencies. The specificgravity of gas. This is a calculated value.
Column Comment.40: GAS OIL RATIO: Value for the gas oil ratio (the amount of natural gas divided by theamount of crude oil).
Column Comment.41: GAS OIL RATIO OUOM: Gas oil ratio original unit of measure.
Column Comment.42: H2S PERCENTAGE: Percentage of hydrogen sulfide (H2S) present and recordedduring the formation test.
Column Comment.43: HOLE CONDITION: The condition of the wellbore. For example: good, washed-out,sloughed, mud caked...
Column Comment.44: MAXIMUM CONDENSATE FLOW RATE: Value for the condensate flow rate duringthe test.
Column Comment.45: MAXIMUM CONDENSATE FLOW RATE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.46: MAXIMUM GAS FLOW RATE: The maximum gas flow rate during the test (usually aone hour rate converted to a daily gas flow rate).
Column Comment.47: MAXIMUM GAS FLOW RATE OUOM: Maximum gas flow rate original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.48: MAXIMUM HYDROSTATIC PRESSURE: The maximum hydrostatic pressuremeasurement recorded during the formation test.
Column Comment.49: MAXIMUM HYDROSTATIC PRESSURE OUOM: Maximum hydrostatic pressureoriginal unit of measure.
Column Comment.50: MAX OIL FLOW RATE: Value for the maximum oil flow rate during the test, usually aone hour rate converted to a daily oil flow rate.
Column Comment.51: MAXIMUM OIL FLOW RATE OUOM: Maximum oil flow rate original unit of measure.
Column Comment.52: MAXIMUM WATER FLOW RATE: The maximum water flow rate during the test(usually a one hour rate converted to a daily water flow rate).
Column Comment.53: MAXIMUM WATER FLOW RATE OUOM: Maximum water flow rate original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.54: OIL AMOUNT PERCENT: Identifies the percent of oil comprising the total fluidproduced in a specified formation during the testing operation.
Column Comment.55: OIL FLOW AMOUNT: Amount of oil which flowed during the production test.
Column Comment.56: OIL FLOW AMOUNT OUOM: Oil flow amount original unit of measure. Multiplestorage units maybe required.
Column Comment.57: OIL FLOW AMOUNT UNIT: Oil flow unit of measure. Multiple storage units mayberequired.
Column Comment.58: OIL GRAVITY: API oil gravity. It is computed by dividing the specific gravity of a fluidat 60 F into 141.5 and subtracting 131.5.
Column Comment.59: PERMEABILITY QUALITY: Standard quality indicators describing the permeability ofthe tested formation.
Column Comment.60: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.61: FLUID TYPE: Identifies the type of fluids or substances produced by a well or usedfor various operations. For example oil, gas, mud or water. NOTE: Identifies is stillbeing evaluated for possible subtyping.
Column Comment.62: PRODUCTION_METHOD: REFERENCE PRODUCTION METHOD: The method ofproduct ion. For example swabbing, flowing, pumping or gas lift.
Column Comment.63: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.64: WELL STRING FORMATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observationnumber used to uniquely identify each completed (perforated) formation (layer) that iscontributing production to a well string.
Column Comment.65: RAT HOLE DIAMETER: The diameter of the rat hole.
Column Comment.66: RAT HOLE DIAMETER OUOM: Rat hole diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.67: RAT HOLE LENGTH: The length of the rat hole.
Column Comment.68: RAT HOLE LENGTH OUOM: Rat hole length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.69: TEST REMARK: Additional comments or remarks describing the formation testingoperation.
Column Comment.70: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.71: REPORT TEMPERATURE: Value for the temperature recorded during a well test.
Column Comment.72: REPORTED TEMPERATURE OUOM: Reported temperature original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.73: REPORT TEST NUMBER: The assigned report test number.
Column Comment.74: SHOW TYPE: This column identifies the appearance of the hydrocarbons in theobject being evaluated. For example, show types can include Asphaltic stain,Bleeding gas, Oil fluorescence,...
Column Comment.75: SI FLOW RATIO: Ratio of the shutin time vs. flow time during a formation test.
Column Comment.76: START TIME: The time of the day the formation test commenced (e.g., 1:30p.m.).
Column Comment.77: START TIMEZONE: The timezone in which this event or status started.
Column Comment.78: STATIC PRESSURE: Pressure on the exerted on the fluid during the test andmeasured after the well has been shutin for a period of time and the maximumpressure has been built up.
Column Comment.79: STATIC PRESSURE OUOM: Static pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.80: STRATIGRAPHIC AGE: The stratigraphic age of the tested formation.
Column Comment.81: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.82: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.83: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.84: SULPHUR INDICATOR: Indicates sulphur is present during the well test.
Column Comment.85: TOTAL DEPTH: Maximum depth of the borehole at the time of the well test.
Column Comment.86: TOTAL DEPTH OUOM: Total depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.87: TEMPERATURE CORRECTION: The value of the temperature correction applied tothe data.
Column Comment.88: TEMPERATURE CORRECTION INDICATOR: Correction flag for temperature. Usedfor RFT tests
Column Comment.89: TEMPERATURE CORRECTION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the original unitsapplied to the data.
Column Comment.90: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.91: TEST DATE: Date the test was conducted.
Column Comment.92: TEST DURATION: Duration of time required to conduct the production test.
Column Comment.93: TEST DURATION OUOM: Test period duration original unit of measure
Column Comment.94: TEST HOLE DIAMETER: A measurement of the diameter of the bore hole.
Column Comment.95: HOLE DIAMETER OUOM: Borehole size original unit of measure.
Column Comment.96: TEST RESULT: Identifies describes, in general terms, the final result of a well test.For example successful, misrun, pipe failure, packer failure or tester plugged.
Column Comment.97: TEST SUBTYPE: A detailed description of the specific type of well test performed.For example: casing packer, hook wall packer, straddle packer...
Column Comment.98: TOOL OPEN TIME: The time of day the tool was open to begin the formation test(e.g., 3:30p.m.) This is standard time, not a duration.
Column Comment.99: TOOL OPEN TIMEZONE: The timezone in which the tool was open to begin theformation test.
Column Comment.100: TOP CHOKE DESCRIPTION: A description of the top choke diameter (e.g., 1 1/2inches).
Column Comment.101: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the test interval.
Column Comment.102: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.103: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.104: WATER AMOUNT PERCENT: Identifies the percent of water comprising the totalfluid produced in a specified formation during the testing operation.
Column Comment.105: WATER CUT PERCENTAGE: The water cut percentage. The fraction of watervolume produced from a well.
Column Comment.106: WATER FLOW AMOUNT: Amount of water that flowed during the production test.
Column Comment.107: WATER FLOW AMOUNT OUOM: Water flow original unit of measure.
Column Comment.108: WATER FLOW AMOUNT UNIT: Water flow unit of measure. Multiple storage unitsmaybe required.
Column Comment.109: WELL BORE COMPLETION TYPE: for the formation test, whether the completion iscommingled, multiple or dual completion. This value is required to support instanceswhere well tests are received but WELL COMPLETION is not used (such as whendetailed information is not available). Reported to regulatory agencies.
Column Comment.110: Z_FACTOR: Number representing the Z (compressibility) factor (the ratio of theactual volume of gas at specific temperature/pressure to the volume of that gascalculated by the ideal gas law). This is a derived value and should be populatedprogrammatically.
Column Comment.111: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.112: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.113: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.114: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.115: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.116: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.117: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
